dialogues.text: (through door) What are you doing?.. Hello? ...E1? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (no response) This is what's known in couple therapy as ‘emotional high-jacking'. Elsa removes the lid of the canister. Mist swirls around the opening like a prop in a magic show.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (through door) You're being a bad ‘responder’ to my ‘inquisition statement’. Using a pair of tongs, she removes a plastic cartridge containing the spliced genetic material.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (through door, becoming serious) El, human cloning's illegal.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: This won't be human. Not entirely. She snaps the cartridge into a servo-guided injection nee A monitor flickers to life, displaying an enlarged image a human egg. Its nucleus is hollowed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive fumbles through his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Seriously. Stop it! He finds a swipe card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door unlocks, Clive enters and quickly shuts it behin him. He gets between her and the controls.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: We could go to jail.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Relax. We won't take it to term. We just need to find out if we can generate a sustainable organism. Then we destroy it. Nobody will ever know.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: What's the point if we can't publish?  21.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: To be sure we really did it. To know for sure. (beat) Are you telling me you don't need to know? Clive shifts on his feet. She's hitting all the right buttons. Still... he remains in the grip of reason.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: It's not that simple. (beat) There are... moral considerations. Elsa raises her eyebrows. She glances at the glowing red button.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Millions of people are suffering and dying with no hope. We might be sitting on the key to save them. What are the moral considerations of that? Clive swallows hard. Her reasoning has trumped his. He follows her gaze to the crimson lit plastic. His mouth tightens.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you want to. Clive's hand reaches out... CLICK. He's hit the button. Instantly, the needle is inserted into the egg and the ge material is injected into the empty nucleus. Conception.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Exactly. An extruding platform carries the petri dish into the inu gestation chamber. A view of the egg appears ON SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's not too late to abort.  30 31 22. Clive watches, enraptured as the petri dish dissolves in murky fluid environment, cells replicating at an unnatura high rate, gene markers radiating like twinkling stars. The process is almost mystical.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: No. Not yet. He puts a reassuring arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In TIME LAPSE we see the cells replicate exponentially, growing in numbers, from a few hundred to thousands, mill and then billions. Blood, veins, flesh and bone stitch together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive walks past a shelf of large specimen jars. Like a disturbing carnival exhibition, they are an inventory of past splicing attempts. Each appears to represent a successive wrung up the evolutionary ladder. And each is labelled with the names of famous celebrity couples: "Bra and Angelina", "Sonny and Cher", "Ashton and Demi", "Boga and Bacall"... ...-Ending at two cages: Ginger and Fred. We see that Fred has grown almost to Ginger's size. They and coo as Clive checks the readings on clipboards hooked the bars. Dexter hovers nearby.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Hey, Maestro, everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, great. You?

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Sure. I guess. Whaddya gonna do? Orders is orders. We'll nail that gene. (beat) But, uh... I can't help but notice you and Elsa have been busy with something. Clive looks up from his chart. A tense beat... he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Building you an Elsa all for yourself.  32 33 23.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Nice. I'1l be sure not to tell the wife.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Our secret. Clive gives Dexter a conspiratorial wink and moves on to inspecting the rest of the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa orbits the gestation chamber, recording stats. She calls up an ultrasound feed. The murky image of a sha that in no way approximates a normal fetus appears. It pu rhythmically in its liquid environment: THROB-THROB, THRO THROB, THROB-THROB... THROB... THR...OB... TH.... It STOPS. Elsa's brow creases with worry. She chews nervously on he pen.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Come on. THROB ...THROB-THROB, THROB-THROB, THROB-THROB, the pulse resumes. Elsa sighs with relief. She turns to a calendar and marks off a square: DAY 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A well-appointed REAL ESTATE AGENT walks Clive and Elsa through a very chic and very expensive loft-style apartme

dialogues.speaker: REAL ESTATE AGENT
dialogues.text: It's a fusion of art nouveau and sixties futurism. Six figures, but the owner will negotiate.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Clive and Elsa confer in one corner while the Real Estate Agent waits to the side.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I fucking love it.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's cool.  24.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: You don't sound so enthusiastic. Is it too expensive?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: It's just... I don't want to have to move again any time soon.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Why would we have to move again?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: It might not be... big enough.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: It's twice the size of our apartment. There's more than enough room for all our stuff.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Yeah but... But you know. For down the road. Elsa can see that Clive is hedging around her questions.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: You're talking about a kid, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Is that so unreasonable?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah. Cause I'm the one who has to have it. Jeeze. What's wrong with you? Guys aren't even supposed to want kids.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: That's not true. And I don't see what's wrong with it.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: This is what's wrong. I like this place. I don't want to bend my life to suit a third party that doesn't even exist yet. I want control over my life. You know how important that is for me. Clive is about to respond when his Blackberry begins to c  34 35 36 37 25.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: (looking at the Blackberry) It's an alarm... From the lab... Something's wrong. With the gestation cell. OFF Elsa's concerned look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive and Elsa's GTO races to their lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive drives like a madman, Elsa riding shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: (worried) Do you think someone found it?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: You mean shut it down? (to reassure her but not believing it) Nah, probably a power surge or a glitch. I'm sure everything's fine. Nevertheless, Clive floors it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive and Elsa reach the entrance but the door is locked. The security desk is empty, there's no Yuji, just a sign that reads, "Gone for Ramen".

dialogues.speaker: YUJI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yo, Dr. C and E. Through the glass door, Yuji can be seen shambling down t hall with Rastafarian cool and a steaming cup of noodles.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Open the fucking door, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Clive and Elsa rush in. At the end of the room, the artificial womb is belching and groaning, f freely gushing from its chrome hull. Clive glances at the monitor: "PREPARING BREACH OF FETAL

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Something's wrong. FLOOSH! The machine spews more fluid. Louder GROANING.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: It's trying to come out.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: It's too soon. Way too soon! Clive and Elsa quickly throw on medical gowns, masks, and gloves. The machine contracts again, a wave of fluid flus out. Nothing else. Elsa checks the ultrasound.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's... grown. It's too big. The machine emits a METALLIC CREAK.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: The pressure will kill it! Elsa hits a button on the side of the machine. The PULSIN GROAN winds down to a soft hum. The flushing of fluid subsides and the machine's orifice dilates. Elsa wedges h arm inside. Clive watches, apprehensive.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Come on... come on! (up to her elbow) Slippery. I can't... Elsa finally seems to get a grip when her arm is abruptly yanked deeper into the machine. Her chin bangs against th hull. She lets out a startled yelp.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: What is it?! Tears well in Elsa's terrified eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: It's... Biting!

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Hold on! Clive snaps into action. He fumbles with a series of hand bolts along the hull. With the last clasp unlocked, he's able to open the entire chassis, releasing a torrent of viscous fluid and revealing... A_DARK BLOB OF FLESH with a_long serpentine tail wrapped around Elsa's wrist.  27. Responding to the sudden light, the FLESHY BULK releases Elsa's hand and rolls to the floor with a wet SLAP. It spasms and writhes on the spot like a horrid featurele abortion. The stinger-tipped tail whips about frantically Clive rips the dome off the incubator and drops it over t creature, effectively trapping it. Meanwhile, Elsa's hand is SWELLING inside the torn rubber glove. She pulls it away to reveal horrible lacerations where she has been stung repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold still. But Elsa is losing control of her motor functions. Her mo contorts strangely, her eyes roll. She falls to her knees then onto her back, convulsing on the hard tile floor.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Elsa?! Clive ties the rubber glove around her arm, cutting circulation, then rushes to a FIRST-AID CABINET. With surprisingly steady hands, he jams an epi-pen between his teeth, then fills a huge syringe from a bottle of clear f Clive drops to his knees at Elsa's side. By now she is completely immobile, eyes rolled back in her head, barely perceptible shaking in one leg. She's stopped breathing. Though his hands and movements are steady, Clive's face i awash with terror. He jabs the epi-pen into her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hang in there! I've got you! Clive feels for a spot between two ribs, takes a deep bre then plunges the large syringe into her chest. He watches desperately as nothing happens. Then, abruptly, Elsa's lungs burst to life. She is GASPIN for breath. Her irises roll back where they belong. She grabs his arm, chest heaving.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: What. What...was that? Clive looks to the creature trapped under the incubator l

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: A mistake.  28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa, arm in a sling, watches as Clive wheels the incubat containing the creature into the containment chamber and seals the door shut. Elsa stands, unsteady. Clive approaches, holds her close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pale light of dawn creeps into the room. Elsa is soun asleep while Clive tosses and turns. Finally, Clive shake Elsa's leg, startling her awake.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Do you think it's in pain?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Huh? What?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Do you think it's in pain?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Why would it be in pain?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Because it's not formed right.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: That doesn't mean it's in pain.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Yeah. It probably does. Clive stares at the ceiling. Elsa isn't sure how to respo

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Alright. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill it. Elsa is more fully awake. She props herself up on an elbo

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: There's still a lot we can learn. (beat) Find out how close we came. To something sustainable. Clive whips back the sheets, sitting up. He's clearly ups

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's okay... Clive, it's all right.  40 29.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: It's not all right. It's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hybrid is trapped inside the incubator, which in turn sealed within the containment chamber. Clive and Elsa sta by the door. They have taken the added precaution of wear full-body hermetic suits with helmets.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CONTAINMENT ROOM
dialogues.text: The door opens and Clive and Elsa enter. The Hybrid lies utterly still in its glass prison.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Is it dead? Clive reaches a hand into one of the thick rubber gloves built into the side of the pod...

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Careful. ...-And gently prods the carcass. Nothing. Dead as dirt.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well... it's not in pain now.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: I'll bag it. Clive passes through to the OBSERVATION ROOM, the door shutting behind him. Elsa opens the lid of the incubator for a closer look at creature. She's puzzled to find the locking clasp coated a sticky secretion and rattling loosely off the lid. With her gloved hands, she rolls the Hybrid over. There is a gaping hole in its underbelly. It's just a hollow exoskeleton.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: (to herself) Empty... The realization dawns on her that whatever shed this skin might still be alive. And broken out of the pod. Something skitters noiselessly across the floor behind he

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of earshot, Clive pulls a haz-mat bag from a drawer.

dialogues.speaker: CONTAINMENT CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Now seriously afraid, Elsa looks around the room. The lim view afforded by her helmet forces her to clock her entir body. The room appears empty. She slowly turns... RIGHT INTO THE FACE OF THE CREATURE, hanging suspended up down from the molding in the ceiling. Elsa SCREAMS and jumps back. The creature drops from its perch, landing awkwardly on t ground. It rights itself on unsteady feet. Elsa reacts, getting her first good look at the thing: The Hybrid has morphed into A_ SMALL, BALD FEMALE CHILD. profoundly malformed child. Its eyes are set on the sides of its head. Arms are absent. Legs are triple-jointed end with prehensile feet. The LONG TAIL with a BARBED TIP is the only feature it has retained from its previous incarnation. The overall package seems incomplete; even the skin has n fully formed, leaving an IRREGULAR LESION vertically bise it from head to crotch. The creature hisses and whips its venomous tail.

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Clive turns to the window. From his angle he can only see the abject terror in Elsa's face.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: It's alive! Clive cranes his neck, sees the creature finally, between Elsa and the door, her only way out.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Jesus... He is about to enter but Elsa warns:

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don't! It'll get out!  31.

dialogues.speaker: CONTAINMENT CHAMBER
dialogues.text: The creature becomes increasingly agitated by Elsa's pres She shuffles a careful step sideways. And the Hybrid bolts at her. Elsa reflexively covers hers

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Clive watches, helpless as the Hybrid tears clumsily over Elsa's body, literally bouncing off the window before scurrying into a corner of the room.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Get out! I'm going to gas it!

dialogues.speaker: CONTAINMENT CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Elsa gathers herself. She has a clear path to the door no She sees the Hybrid cowering in the corner, senses its fe

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Wait... Don't kill it!

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: (over the intercom) Elsa, get out! I'm hitting the gas! In THREE... Elsa brings herself down to the Hybrid's level. The Hybri opens its child-like mouth, revealing a toothless gummy m and releases a HORRIFIC SCREECH.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (over the intercom) TWO... Elsa is clearly disturbed by the force of this outburst. The Screech HOLDS ITS NOTE for a long moment, before chan in timbre, slowly fading into a MOURNFUL WAIL - like the of a bawling baby.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: (near whisper) It's okay. I won't hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: (over intercom) ONE...

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Clive! I said DON'T! Elsa rips off her helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive can't believe it. His hand is on a valve, ready to terminate the creature. He leans into the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Elsa. Put on your helmet, damn it!

dialogues.speaker: CONTAINMENT CHAMBER
dialogues.text: An extraordinary thing happens: At the sight of Elsa's ex face, the Hybrid calms. It's as if the creature recognize something familiar in her.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: It's imprinting.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: (over intercom) It's dangerous. Get out. Elsa is too caught up in the magic of this moment.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: (to Hybrid) I'm not going to hurt you. Elsa waddle/walks closer to the creature. It cocks its he to one side in nervous, flitting bird-like movements. But it no longer seems as frightened.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're really something, aren't you? Elsa removes the glove from her unharmed hand and gingerl extends it for the Hybrid. The creature gives it a few cautionary sniffs. Elsa's sce seems to meet its approval. It blinks sideways with nictitating eyelids and takes a cautious hop forward. Elsa smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's it. Suddenly, the creature's face curls into a snarl. It hiss and its tail flails out defensively. Elsa reacts, waddlin backwards, confused until she realizes the creature is actually reacting to...

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: .--Behind her, helmeted and wielding a metal prod like a weapon. He grabs her and forcibly pulls her from the room quickly shutting and locking the door behind them. The creature stares after them, frightened and confused.  41 42 43 44 45 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive is furious.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?! Are you trying to get yourself killed?!

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I had the situation under control.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: You're forgetting why we came here.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: We can't do that now. Look at it! Clive can't believe what he's hearing.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: So what! Elsa virtually hip-checks him away from the panel, and ge her hands on a series of valves.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Let's just knock it out -- Find out what we've got. Elsa turns on a combination of gas valves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vents open in the walls. A HISS. The creature sniffs the air, cowers from the encroaching gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive observes Elsa watching coolly as the creature flutt around the room like a butterfly in a jar, until it final succumbs to the fumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hybrid breathes with a deep, sharp wheezing as it lie in forced slumber in a cylinder-shaped MRI MACHINE. A LOUD HUM AND FLASHING LIGHTS as the machine scans her anatomy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Images from the MRI play out on a computer screen.  34. The Hybrid now lies strapped to a table while Elsa prods its tail. Clive can't suppress his amazement.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: This is unbelievable. I don't know what half of this is.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Must have been some rogue elements. Junk genes pushing through. Elsa presses a gloved-thumb beneath its tip and a SHARP S protrudes from a hood of skin. It drips with a sticky goo that Elsa smears onto a slide.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Some kind of self-defense mechanism.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Or attack venom.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: None of her animal components have predatory characteristics.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Well... there's the human element. Elsa gives him a wry smirk. Clive shifts his attention to the computer output from the MRI. A series of cross-secti X-rays flicker on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are these dark splotches? Elsa looks up from examining blood samples. On the screen Clive points out two jet-black masses in the chest cavity

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Lungs?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: No... (indicating lighter patches ) These are the lungs.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Tumors?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Guess we'll find out in the autopsy. Elsa stares at the Hybrid, not at all happy about the ide of killing it.  35.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Elsa, this was never supposed to go this far. It wasn't even supposed to go full term.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: But it did.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: We were just going to prove we could do it. That was all.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: So what are you saying? Are you really going to kill it? Clive glances over to the sleeping hybrid, eerily human-l

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You think you can do that? Clive's mouth tightens without comment. Elsa pulls him over to the table where her microscope sit She points to the video tap: a microscopic view of rapidl dividing cells.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See that? It must have developed the Ambysotma growth gene.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: It's aging fast.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Days within a matter of minutes. (beat) This thing is going to die soon, anyway. We'll be able to observe its entire life cycle in compressed time. (beat) We'll never have an opportunity like this again. Clive bites his lip. She's playing him perfectly. He glan at the Hybrid.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: So it's dying?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: She's dying. All by herself.  46 36. Clive looks apprehensive, but staring at the creature, he can't quite suppress a powerful fascination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New equipment is being installed for the breakdown and analysis of chemicals, disturbing the work of several of LAB STAFF. Dexter swabs samples of Ginger's dorsal excretions, while Clive pulls a blood sample. The little creature shakes un the needle.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Estrogen level's been low these days.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: What do you mean "these days"? How long?

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: It's in the logs. Every test, every stat. Dexter hands Clive a thick file.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Sorry. I... I'ma little worn out. He leafs absently through stats.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: I, um... guess that thing, that experiment you've got going on... Still not ready to talk about it? Clive closes the file and regards his brother's aching curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: I can tell you it's big. Pretty big. And we need your help. Dexter quickly perks up at the pleasing prospect of involvement.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Sure... anything. Clive puts his hand on Dexter's shoulder, squeezing it inclusively.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: This experiment... it's really important that it doesn't get disturbed. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need you to make sure that nobody... I mean nobody gets inside the containment room.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Sure. Absolutely. Nobody gets in. (hopefully) Not even...? (pointing to himself) Clive smiles, and shakes his head. Dexter shrugs off his disappointment with a grin.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Sorry. Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hybrid is NOW THE SIZE OF A TODDLER and harnessed by three-foot lead to the leg of a floor-bolted workbench. A plastic container has been taped on as a protective cov for her tail stinger. She scratches at it with some irritation. Clive eyes the tail nervously as he attempts to feed her bowl of wet green mush with a turkey-baster. Elsa watches, talking into a hand-held voice recorder.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: (into recorder) We've got H-50 on a diet of chlorophyll, roughage, bean curd, and enriched starch. As quickly as Clive tries to jam the baster into the Hybr mouth, she either turns her head or spits the food out.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into recorder) She seems resistant to feeding, though her rapid growth should generate a proportionate appetite. Clive tries to squeeze a little more goo into the Hybrid' stubborn mouth. He receives a green blob to the forehead for his efforts.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: We're going to have to do this with a drip feed.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: She'll just rip it out.  48 49 38. The Hybrid sniffs the air, sensing something. Suddenly, a leg lashes out at Elsa with a SHOCKINGLY FAST KICK. Both she and Clive recoil. Then they see it: The Hybrid's tiny, hand-like foot has snatched the box of Nerds from E lab coat. She is gobbling the candy like a starved animal Elsa watches amazed, an idea forming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa crumbles several nerds between two spoons, then mixe them into the Hybrid's mush. She holds the spoon up to the Hybrid's mouth. This time nostrils flair and she happily wolfs the food down. Clive now commandeers the voice recorder.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: (into recorder) Tracking her feeding habits, we've determined that the H-50 craves high- sucrose foodstuffs. Elsa wipes a little goo from the side of the Hybrid's mou A long tongue darts out, precisely cleaning Elsa's finger She gives Elsa what might be considered a smile. Elsa smi back and continues the feeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive sits with Barlow in his downtown office. Three smal armchairs have been jammed into a corner of the room near his desk. One is empty. Clive looks a little ruffled by stress and bad sleep.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Where's Elsa?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: At the lab. Holding things together.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: She isn't too happy about the new directive, is she?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: It was a bit of a shock.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: I understand. Barlow leans in close, as though the walls might be liste  39.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Truth is, if we don't start projecting profits, big profits, soon... Novaphorm's in serious trouble. Clive looks genuinely startled. Barlow grabs Clive's hand like a terminal patient imploring his doctor for a cure.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Phase 2 is not an option. It's all we've got. You'll impress that on her, Clive, won't you?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: We're on side, Bill. Trust me. Barlow, relieved, abruptly changes tone to one of chummy encouragement.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Look at it this way. We're sparing you a lot of grief. The world's not ready to mess with the human animal. (beat) You know Kwan over at Geneteck?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Tim Kwan?

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: (nods ) He stepped over the line... Right into a ten year prison term. Clive takes this in...

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Genius is punished when it's ahead of the times. (beat) All through history. ..-And swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hybrid is a little larger than when we last saw her. Elsa gives her a routine physical examination, while spea into her voice recorder. Clive sits quietly in the corner, flipping through the lo books on Fred and Ginger, trying to get up to date.  40.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: (into recorder) H-50's physiological anomalies continue to emerge. Swelling in the Latissimus Dorsi and Teris Major and Minor muscles. Elsa notices pronounced bruising and swelling from the ri cage along to the back. Her expression betrays sympathy b her voice remains clinical.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into recorder) It's possible that aspects of her anatomy may be ill-suited to emerging mutations... Elsa winces at the painfully tender look of the flesh. Wh she prods the bruises, the Hybrid writhes from her touch.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into recorder) The overall structure could become unstable leading to malignancies and... Elsa can't finish the sentence.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's too soon to make any assumptions. She clicks off her voice recorder and gathers her papers.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Clive) You'll be alright, then? Clive looks up from his work.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: El, you haven't taken a break in days. Elsa kisses Clive on the cheek...

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Call if there's a problem. -.. and heads for the door. The Hybrid looks alarmed. She hops after Elsa, jerks short when she reaches the end of lead. Then cries out, her alien tones settling into the a too familiar timber of a human baby. Elsa regards her, doing her best to maintain cool composu

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll be back tomorrow.  51 41. Conflicted, she turns to go. A SICK, TEARING SOUND and a SCREAM. Clive jumps up as Elsa spins around in time to see... The Hybrid's back spasms, muscles twist, flesh stretches grotesquely as if something inside were trying to break o RIIIIP! A slender girlish arm erupts from her side. Bleed and dripping with shreds of skin, it lashes out and grips Elsa's leg with two bony fingers and an opposing thumb.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Holy fuck! Elsa instinctively yanks her leg but the Hybrid holds on tight. The creature CRIES OUT LOUDER, possibly as much from emot heartache as physical pain. And another lanky arm bursts out of the other side of her bruised, fleshy back. Clive takes out their cam-corder, capturing the whole incredible event on video. Elsa stares down at the Hybrid, freaked-out by the bloody appendages desperately clawing her pant leg.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: El, careful... But Elsa surrenders to the irresistible need to comfort. bends into the gooey embrace, drawing the hybrid close. T creature's cries trail off into hiccuping breaths of reli Clive's brow furrows from behind the viewfinder, reacting this blatantly emotional display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa gets behind the wheel and inserts her key into the ignition. But she hesitates before turning it, staring ba at the entrance to the lab. She bites a nail, nervously. Then quickly composes hersel and starts the car, mumbling reassurances to herself.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: She'll be alright. It's fine. She'll be fine. Elsa swings out of the parking space.  52 53 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hybrid is WAILING at the top of her lungs. She is apparently NOT fine. The torn skin on her back has been carefully bandaged wit gauze and tape, but she seems emotionally stricken by Els absence. Clive tries to approach, imploring her to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Hey, it's okay. She'll be back. The Hybrid continues to wail at full volume. Clive steps forward. The Hybrid quickly skitters towards the corner, as far as her rope will let her. Her tail fla back and forth menacingly, its plastic bottle clattering the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take it easy! C'mon. I'm here. She cranks up her crying another notch.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Think of all the new things we can do now. (smiling) We can arm wrestle! The Hybrid's cry sputters and stalls a moment. Clive look relieved - he's getting through. But she is just filling her lungs for another, even louder EMOTIONAL BLAST. Hands on his ears, Clive can't take it. He staggers out o the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive inserts coins into a vending machine, relieved to b momentarily away from the cacophony. His coffee comes dow the chute and as he reaches to retrieve it, he hears... THE HYBRID'S WAILING... faint and distant, but unmistakab Clive shakes his head, thinking he's hearing things until his eyes land on the air duct next to the fridge. Her voi is coming up through the ventilation system. Panicking, he scans the room. There are a few LAB TECHNIC snacking at the far end, who haven't yet heard. The Hybrid's voice seems to be getting louder still. Thin quickly, Clive fumbles with a radio on top of the fridge.  54 55 43. He turns it on to a talk show. The creature's voice still cuts through. Clive spins the dial until he tunes into a LOUD HEAVY MET STATION - mid-guitar solo. He cranks the volume. Her voic is finally drowned out. He looks back to the Technicians. One LONG-HAIRED TECHIE holds up his fore-finger and pinky (devil's horns) as a s of appreciation to Clive. Clive forces a smile and returns the gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa digs musty boxes out of a hallway closet. She pulls out the one she was looking for. It's labeled "Private... Elly's Stuff" in childish scrawl. She opens it with a mixture of excitement and dread. Insi are an assortment of child's toys: a ratty STUFFED DOG, a MINIATURE BICYCLE, a WOODEN HORSE. One toy in particular draws her attention... a BARBIE DOLL circa 1980. Memories flood. Something else catches her eye. She digs in deeper, finds dog-eared photo. It's a picture of a five year old Elsa a her Mother standing by the family farm - a stern woman wi an arm protectively wrapped around her daughter, her long dark hair sports Elsa's single streak of white. Elsa regards it for a long moment. But rather than trigge fond memories, the photo only seems to inspire melancholy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NEW DAY: Elsa checks the bandages at the extraction poi where the Hybrid's arms erupted from her back. The creature seems beguiled by these new aspects of her b She waves and flexes them with delighted bird-like CHORTL She reaches out tentatively, stroking Elsa's curls.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: You like that? You like hair? (suddenly remembering) Oh, hey, I found some things for you. Elsa pulls out her box of toys and sets it down between t Hybrid's legs.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See anything else you like?  56

The Hybrid pushes around awkwardly in the box, intrigued the shapes, but is instantly drawn to the Barbie doll. Sh has some trouble gripping with her new hands, so Elsa hel her, wrapping her own hand around the Hybrid's fingers. Together they hold Barbie in the air between them.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in a breathy Barbie voice) Hi there. I'm Barbie. I like cute guys, fast cars and funny little creatures like you. Elsa slowly lets go of the Hybrid's hand, pleased to see grip the doll on her own.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She was my secret friend. I wasn't allowed to have her, so I had to keep her hidden. (beat) Just like you. The Hybrid turns it around clumsily, studying it from all angles. She strokes the hair, completely entranced.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's right. She has hair too. Elsa watches wistfully. There's something a little sad ab this bald creature so fascinated by hair. The Hybrid's he begins to bob with fatigue, eyes drooping. She leans her forehead on Elsa's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're tired. That's all right. We'll play later. The hybrid nuzzles deeper into Elsa's shoulder. At first little nervous, Elsa gathers the creature into her lap an cradles her. The Hybrid instantly begins to relax. And Elsa finds herself rocking her and humming, softly. If we listen closely the we might recognize the melody as "Unde My Skin". The creature's eyelids droop, her neck relaxes. Within moments, she is breathing deeply -- asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unseen by Elsa, Clive watches through the one-way mirror, her HUMMING broadcast over the intercom. He is clearly troubled by this tableau.  45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a private corner, Elsa wolfs down NERDS and talks rapi riding a sugar-fueled high. Clive listens. His face betra concern.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I think it's a form of hypometamorphosis. Her tissue liquefies and reforms. That's why we can't track it with MRI or x-rays. At this point, there's no telling what she might become. And it's not just her body. Her intelligence is developing fast. She figures things out.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: We have to be careful not to project too much onto her.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: She's not just a collection of instincts. She thinks.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Of course she thinks. Dogs think. But... A TECHIE passes. They nod greetings, pausing their conversation until he's out of earshot.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (quiet) ...-But dogs aren't capable of complex associative reasoning.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: You're wrong. She just needs time. Clive watches Elsa carefully, measuring her up.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: You know what we need?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: We need to act our age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive and Elsa share a booth at the same club where Clive was ‘shot'. The air prickles with its usual high-energy throb. Elsa sips from a glass of wine, looking restless.  59 46. Clive taps the BREAKNECK BEAT with his fingernails on the table, grooving to the psychedelic mayhem.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Hey, come on. Let's dance.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: No. Thanks. I don't feel like it. Clive barrels past his disappointment. He reaches into hi pocket and produces Elsa's dropper-vial of liquid excitem

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: I know what you need. A little drop of fun. Elsa shakes her head without apology. Clive's smile falls

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I'm having fun. But you go ahead. Go for it. Clive's determination is losing steam. He pockets the via

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: No. I'm okay. I'm fine. (unconvincing) This is fun. The noise of the club floods into their vacuum of conversation. Eventually, Elsa gathers up her purse and shuffles out of the booth.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I want to go. I want to go back. (beat) She shouldn't be left alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa has let the Hybrid out of containment. She is now ab the size of a FIVE YEAR OLD CHILD, with fully developed, spindly arms. There are a few emerging stands of hair, wh only emphasize her baldness. Sitting cross-legged on the floor, Elsa watches with deli as the Hybrid successfully places A SPOON onto a piece of paper with a drawn outline of a spoon.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: That's right. Spoon. (beat) Now "Dog". Do the dog!  47. The Hybrid quickly picks up the tiny STUFFED DOG and plac it onto a sheet of paper with a crudely drawn dog. Elsa claps her hands delighted.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's it! Dog! It's getting too easy for you, isn't it? The Hybrid cocks her head expectantly. Elsa spills severa Nerds into the creature's hand, which she quickly scarfs.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You could do this all day. Elsa scuffles over to the table and pulls down a large bo

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's try something different. She pulls a Deluxe-Edition Scrabble game from its box and places the board between them. It's the kind with a lazy- Susan base, and raised ridges to line up the letters. Elsa spills the bag of letters onto the floor and quickly rummages for the tiles she wants. She arranges the letter P-E-N onto the board then pivots it so the word appears upright to the Hybrid. She holds up a PEN, then points to the letters.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: P-E-N! That says PEN. PEN! She puts down the pen and points to the word.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's that? Show me. Show me the pen. The Hybrid just stares at her blankly. Elsa arranges the letters of her own name, E-L-S-A.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's ELSA. Me. (tapping her chest) I'm Elsa. Elsa. The Hybrid's face is a blank slate of incomprehension. El points back to the first word, and holds up the ballpoint

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: PEN! This is a PEN. (tapping her chest) ELSA. I'm Elsa. Pen... Elsa.  48. Elsa searches the Hybrid's face, desperate to detect the slightest sign of association. Nothing. Elsa notices the Hybrid's gaze is fixated on the box of N in her breast pocket. She spills a couple into her palm - incentive. The Hybrid's eyes dart, her mouth opens slight Holding the Nerds hostage in her palm, Elsa points again the word: PEN.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's that? PEN. (beat) Where's the pen? Still nothing. Not a glimmer. Elsa pops the Nerds into he own mouth with a sigh, then tips the board, spilling the letters to the floor. She sees palpable disappointment in the Hybrid's eyes -- reacting to the lost reward. Elsa gets another idea. She rifles through the tiles, plucking up five letters to spell the word: N-E-R-D-S. She rotates the board, then holds up the box of candy whe the same letters are clearly marked on the label: NERDS. The Hybrid's eyes flit quickly from the Nerds to the Scra board, then back to the Nerds. Elsa smiles. Something's starting to click.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nerds... C'mon. You know what Nerds are. The Hybrid reaches out a spindly hand to touch the tiles, her eyes skipping to the actual package of candy.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's right. They're the same.

dialogues.speaker: NERDS
dialogues.text: The Hybrid abruptly pops the letter S into her mouth, che and quickly swallows it. Elsa gasps. The Hybrid makes a sour expression, as though she'd been tricked. Elsa's momentary dismay is replaced by a triumphant grin.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You did it! You made a connection! Good girl! Elsa spills some real Nerds onto the game board and the H quickly gobbles them up. The door opens behind Elsa. She spins quickly to greet Clive. The Hybrid cowers at his arrival.  49.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She did it!

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: She can associate!

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: (annoyed) What is she doing in this room? You can't let her out.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Specimens need to be contained.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Don't call her that.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: What are we supposed to call her? Elsa quickly scans the room, looking for a name. On the Scrabble board are the remaining four (un-eaten) tiles spelling NERD. Of course, they are upside-down to Elsa.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: DREN. Her name is Dren. DREN, the Hybrid, scuttles into the corner. Clive is sudd furious.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: You're talking like... You're treating her like she's a... (catching himself) A pet!

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I'm compiling a developmental profile. She needs more stimulation than that room.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Well, we're screwed now. They're renovating this entire wing. Tomorrow! So what the hell are we going to do about that?! Dren's eyes narrow at his raised voice. Elsa, now angry herself, yanks an equipment cart from the side of the roo  50.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Alright, so we'll move her. We'll put her in the storage room downstairs. Nobody goes down there.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: What are we doing? Why are we taking all these risks? Elsa yanks equipment from the lower shelves of the cart.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: When the hell did you get so fucking scared of everything! Something triggers in Clive. He takes three furious steps into Elsa's face. Yelling now. Loudly.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: Dren flings herself across the room and lands squarely on Clive. He falls backwards, hitting the floor hard. Dren's tail waves wildly, flinging off the protective cover. The poison spike withdraws from its fleshy sheath, poised sting!

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Dren freezes, then turns her head to Elsa.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (cool, in command) Go to your place. Dren eyes Clive once more before obediently skulking back into her corner. Clive sits up, breathing heavily, still little afraid.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's okay. She won't hurt you. She helps Clive up.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know we have a situation. But we just have to deal with it.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: (struggling to contain himself) A situation? She could have killed me!  60 51. Clive and Dren eye each other warily. Elsa loads a cardbo box into the lower portion of the cart.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Don't be melodramatic. Let's just solve this.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Jesus fucking Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa and Clive wheel the cart with equipment on top. A bo labelled, Sequence Driver, rests beneath. The top shifts. Dren's eyes peer out. Elsa pushes her gently back down.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Stay inside, Dren. Clive nervously glances around the corner. Coast is clear

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: She okay?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Scared. It's all right. They truck the cart around the corner and manage to get t the freight elevator undetected. Elsa hits the down butto The elevator rises up from the basement at a snail's pace Finally the doors open, revealing... Dexter, who looks startled to see them.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Wow. I don't think I've seen the two of you together in weeks.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Hey, Dex. Dexter's eyes land on the EEG machine on top of the cart with a variety of other devices.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Where are you going with that?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Storage. It's not working. We need to order a new...

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: (confused) What do you mean, not working? I had it hooked up to Fred yesterday. Clive isn't sure what to say. Dexter searches their faces  52.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's going on? THE CLACKING OF MEN'S SHOES. Clive looks over his shoulde and sees Barlow striding down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Shit. Elsa flicks hair from her face, trying to play it cool. Clive swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: I've been looking for you two everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Whazup? Barlow glances at the cart of equipment.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: What's all this?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Just some junk we're trashing. Barlow is suddenly curious. He fingers the EEG machine on the top of the cart.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Pretty state-of-the-art junk. What else are you...? To Clive and Elsa's horror, Barlow quickly bends down to bottom of the cart and opens the box containing Dren! Bar tips the box to reveal that the it's empty - Dren is gone Clive scans the hallway. Nothing. They catch each other's eye, bewildered. Elsa bucks up...

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: What can we do for you, Bill? Barlow quickly loses interest in the equipment.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Listen. Great news. We're going to present Fred and Ginger at the annual shareholder's meeting. Clive and Elsa are completely distracted, scanning for so sign of missing Dren.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Shareholders?  53.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: We impress them with the H-40's, Novaphorm stock will go through the roof...

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: I dunno Bill, we're pretty busy... The elevator doors slide closed. Elsa quickly slaps the down button again, they slide back open. She enters the elevator half expecting to find Dren in there. The elevat empty. She remains inside, holding the door with her hand

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: I thought you'd be excited. Don't you wanna show them off? Clive is anxious to get rid of Barlow.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess. He looks nervously to Elsa, who is staring oddly at Dexte

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Alright then. Let's meet. I've got to prepare a budget. Something drips on Barlow's shoulder. He doesn't notice. Clive follows Elsa's eyes to Dexter. His mortified gaze i fixated on the ceiling, where Dren is wedged like a tree toad_in the corner above Barlow. Her tail swings back and forth, ready to pounce. Clive stifles his shock. Barlow takes one last look at the EEG machine.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You sure we can't fix it? Sometimes you guys act like there's money coming out of... Suddenly Dexter speaks up, a hair too loudly.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: It's fried! Totally fucked! We need a new one. Right away. Barlow's eyebrows raise at Dexter's outburst. Over his shoulder, Elsa peels Dren off the wall, and swings her in the elevator. Dexter takes Barlow by the arm and gently guides him away from the elevator.  61 62 54.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, Bill... I've got some requisition forms, on my desk. If you can push the purchase through... Dexter hazards a glimpse back at Clive, who tosses back a quick look of appreciation, and then shoves the cart into the elevator. Barlow calls after them as the doors close.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Call me! Barlow feels the wetness on his shoulder. Brings his fing to his nose, sniffs them, sensing something is up but una to pin down exactly what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa and Clive roll the cart quickly up to the door of th storage room.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: God, I hate that guy.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Why, because he plays by the rules?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Because he loves them. Elsa quickly keys open the door and pushes the cart insid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inside of the storage room is lined with shelves, cluttered with old boxes, obsolete equipment, and forgott cleaning products. At the far end there's plumbing and a huge industrial sink. Stepping inside propels a cloud of dust into the air.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: (furious) You know, sticking to a few fucking rules isn't always such a bad idea. Elsa draws Dren from below the cart and into her arms, lo a little queasy. Clive steps back, wary.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Nobody's going to care about a few rules. After they see what we've made...  63 55.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: See what we've made! Nobody can see what we've made!

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Once they see Ginger and Fred, don't you think the world's going to want to know what's next? She holds Dren's face next to her own, as though this wer all she needed to make her case to the world.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you think they can look at this face... And see anything less than a miracle? Clive's jaw hangs open, stunned at Elsa's naivete. And as if on cue, Dren pukes on Elsa's shoulder, then bur her head miserably in Elsa's chest.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh... oh no. Oh Sweetie, you're sick. Clive shakes his head, astounded. The whole thing is gett to be too much. Elsa puts her wrist to Dren's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clive, she's really hot.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: I've got to talk to Dexter. He leaves, disgusted. Elsa hardly notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive sits with Dexter by the window. The silence between them is so intense, the hum of the Coke machine sounds li a plane landing. Finally Clive can't take it any longer.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Say what you're thinking.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: What I'm thinking? What were you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: It was kind of an accident.  56.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: (incredulous) That kind of an accident takes a hundred million years! Unless... somebody very smart does it on purpose.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Look. I know it's crazy... (beat) But I need your support on this. I need your help. Dexter looks at Clive with a mixture of reluctant loyalty and profound disappointment.

dialogues.text: What? What are we supposed to do? Dren lets out a TRILLING GROAN that ends with a choke and more vomit. Elsa rushes over to wipe her mouth.

dialogues.text: There's no time. Clive gives Elsa a lost, defeated look... like this was inevitable. He shakes his head. Frustration rising. Suddenly, he grabs Dren by the head and pushes her face u water. Elsa SCREAMS.

dialogues.text: Clive! Stop it! She pulls at his arms. Smashes at his shoulder. Dren, wit the little strength she has left, squirms for her life.
