dialogues.text: Clive and Elsa tip-toe away from Dren, sleeping soundly u a blanket on an inflated mattress. They carefully shut the door, locking Dren inside the Bar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has the dark, foreboding quality of any building that hasn't been entered in years. They reach the front porch. Holding a FLASHLIGHT with one hand, Clive unlocks the doo with the other. Elsa braces herself.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: You okay? Elsa bucks up and steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Of course. It's just a house. She shoves open the door with a LOUD CREAK - like a mothe scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive snaps on the lights, though many light bulbs are de The place is cobwebbed and dusty, but otherwise surprisin tidy and spare.  80 81 82 83 74. There's a potbellied stove in the middle of the common ro an open kitchen and a series of bedroom doors along the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to Elsa's old bedroom swings open. Clive peers i at a room devoid of any furnishings or decor. A single tw mattress sits alone in the middle of the floor. Elsa hides a shudder.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: I thought you said your mother kept your room exactly like it was. Elsa's mouth tightens as she turns away.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: She did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A view of the farm seen from a distance: van, barn, farmh The single light in the house turns off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive approaches the security entrance. Dreadlocked-Yuji has been replaced by an anonymous, spit-polished SECURITY GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive enters the remodeled lab, walking down a long line identical, evenly spaced work cubicles. As he passes, the faces of his co-workers stare out mournfully from their b Like prisoners of war, observing their conquered leader i chains. With a sigh, Clive settles into his own cubical. Just ano employee. The first thing he sees is Barlow's head, over the partit

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Where's Elsa?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Not feeling well.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: She's not in?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: She's sick. Barlow's lips tighten.  84 85 75.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: You've got to be fucking kidding me!

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: People get sick. It happens.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: You know, a lot of people would just suck it in. Rise to the occasion. (beat) You guys are not some special case. Not any more. Barlow storms off. Clive is left to stare at the carpet-l containment of his workstation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small family graveyard behind the farmhouse. Elsa stand over a HEADSTONE engraved with: HENDRIKA KAST 1948 - 1996 We can read nothing in her face. Not hate nor love, remor nor resentment. She just stares at the grave, as if to ve beyond any doubt that the woman remains dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior has been enhanced with furniture from the farmhouse as well as some makeshift lab equipment. Left alone, Dren roams the perimeter clutching her Barbie. Her head cocks towards the rafters, letting out an oddly beautiful, but MOURNFUL SONG. Dren stops by a VANITY MIRROR set up at a small table. Sh strokes the doll's hair. Runs a finger along its neck and pulls off the dress. She compares it to her own reflection. Her thin, patchy hair. The strange protrusions along her back and arms. Th alien-looking legs and undeveloped chest. The deep vertic seam down her face and body. The contrast to Barbie enrages her. She SMASHES THE DOLL INTO THE MIRROR. Shards TINKLE away. Dren lines up the Barbie so that its face and body are bisected by a long vertical crack. Barbie still looks impossibly beautiful. Dren throws the doll across the roo Then kicks a chair into the base of the water tank. A MEWING SOUND from behind the tank. Curious, Dren creeps around and discovers a mottled, smal cat has somehow managed to sneak into the barn. It MEOWS her, looking lost, hungry and afraid.  86 87 76. Dren cocks her head, then with frightening speed snatches up. We are instantly reminded of the raccoon's fate. But Dren does not attack. Instead she strokes the animal with one hand, fascinated by the texture of its fur. Dren carries it with her to a workbench at the furthest c of the barn. She pulls aside a plastic sheet and hides herself and the cat in the vacant storage space beneath.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE DREN'S SPACE
dialogues.text: She curls up, petting the cat with a kind of tender grati Something uglier than her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two vehicles pull up in front of the farmhouse. Clive sli down from the driver's side of the van. Elsa issues from their vintage hotrod. Together they unload boxes of equipment and supplies from the back of the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa, Clive and Dren sit at a small folding table. Elsa h trouble getting Dren to eat. Impatiently, she pushes a bo of green muck towards Dren. Dren shoves it back.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Honey, please. Not today. Eat your dinner. Elsa scoops a spoonful of gruel to Dren's mouth, but she turns her head. Clive looks up from some notes.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: She doesn't like it. Maybe she'd prefer meat.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: (snapping) She doesn't eat meat.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Is raccoon considered a vegetable?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: That was just... an accident. (to Dren) C'mon honey. Eat your food, you know you're hungry. Dren refuses.  77.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is it? What's the matter? Dren snatches the bag of scrabble tiles from the bench be her. She frantically sifts through the letters, tossing t ones she needs onto the table randomly: a T, then a D, an an I. Having identified the letters she wants, Dren quickly arr them into a word. T-E-D-I-O-U-S.

dialogues.speaker: TEDIOUS
dialogues.text: (to Clive) She spelled TEDIOUS!

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: (skeptical) Where would she get a word like that?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: She's telling us she's bored. (to Dren) Why are you bored, honey? Do you want to play a game or something? Frustrated, without bothering to seek out more tiles, she rearranges the letters to spell a new word: O-U-T-S-I-D-E Elsa stares down at the anagram with amazement.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, Dren. (sadly apologetic) No, I know. But you can't go outside. I'm sorry. You just can't. In a sudden fit of anger, Dren shoves herself backwards, knocking over the table, food, letters, everything.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dren. Come back here! Dren tears across the room.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come back here, right now! Elsa rushes over, grabs Dren by the neck and arm.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said COME HERE! Physically, Dren is now Elsa's equal, but the Hybrid succ as Elsa pulls her back to the table. Clive rights the furniture and Elsa shoves Dren back into her chair.  88 89 78.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Elsa, cool it. Elsa spins on him.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: You saw what she did! Clive takes Elsa by the shoulders, trying to calm her dow

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: All right. It's over. Elsa is suddenly wracked with guilt and hurt.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I just... She's getting so hard to control.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: But she's okay now. Clive glances over Elsa's shoulder and finds that Dren ha in fact, left her seat. He hears a noise overhead. He and Elsa look up and are startled to see Dren clamoring up a network of pipes leading to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Dren. Stop that! Dren swings along pipes and support beams and deliberatel kicks out panes of glass from the skylight. SMASH! Shards rain down. Clive and Elsa stumble back to avoid them. Dren catapults herself through the skylight and disappear onto the roof.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Shit! They run for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive scrambles up a slender ladder along the back of the arched building. Elsa follows, a few rungs behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof has a narrow path along the center of its arch. One wrong step and it's a slippery slide down to a thirty foot drop. Clive and Elsa climb breathlessly up to see Dren at the f side of the skylight, back arched, eyes wide, once again bedazzled by the breadth of open space.  79. Elsa and Clive slowly shuffle across the roof towards her

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Dren. Sweetie. Come inside, okay? Dren snaps her attention to the approaching couple. She takes a corresponding number of backward steps.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Be careful, honey. We just want you to stay with us. Where you're safe. They ease past the broken windows of the skylight. Dren continues to back away, determined not to be contained.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: C'mon Dren. We're not angry. Dren is getting dangerously close to the far end of the r Elsa looks terrified.

dialogues.speaker: DREN
dialogues.text: Her raised voice startles Dren back another step. Her fee pivot on the edge of the roof. Her torso swings back and forth, desperate to regain her balance.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! Dren overcompensates and is about to fall backwards when. A_cascade of feathers bursts through the skin under her a Magnificent wings with shimmering translucent plumage. The wings instinctively flap, lifting her body just enoug to regain her balance. She releases a triumphant SHRIEK a lets the wings relax and settle at her sides. Shreds of dry, leathery skin flake away in the breeze. With the emergence of the wings, the lumpen, misshapen ma of her back has transformed itself. Her body is now lean, streamlined, elegant and complete. Clive and Elsa observe her speechlessly. Their ugly duckl has become a swan. Dren unfurls her wings proudly, turns to face the forest with its world of sensation and mystery. She crouches as though prepared to launch into flight.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Dren, stop! Dren pauses, looks back over her shoulder.  90 80.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please don't. Dren keeps her eyes trained on Clive. Something in his pleading tone is having an effect. He takes a few cautiou steps forward. Elsa watches, too frightened to interfere.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dren. Don't go. We need you. (gauging her reaction) We... love you, Dren. Clive holds out his hand. Dren feels the pull of freedom. But the pull of Clive is stronger. Her wings abruptly retract. She plunges forward, into his arms. All at once, she is shaking and scared. A terrified child. Clive holds her tight, stroking her back. Elsa allows her to breathe, relieved. And just a tad jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skylight has been boarded shut. The last bit of natur light is cut off. Two sizable steaks are dropped onto an electric grill. Th explode with a LOUD SIZZLE. Clive is cooking. Elsa is examining the latest miracle of Dren's physiology.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: (to Dren) Smells pretty good, huh? Dren watches hungrily from her chair.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be rewarding her for escaping.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: I'm rewarding her for coming back. (to Dren) Good girl. Dren seems to preen at his encouraging tone. Clive can't resist a quick glance down her newly feminized body, the slender trace of an hour-glass figure.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're not a little girl anymore. Are you? (to Elsa) Do you think she'll ever fly?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Don't be ridiculous, she'd need chest muscles like a quarterback. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (indicating the wings) I think they're more... decorative than anything else. Elsa regards Dren wistfully. Like she's lost her baby gir to this new species of young woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next morning. Elsa types notes into her laptop. While eat cereal, Clive studies one of Dren's new feathers, utterly fascinated. He rubs the feather in one direction against the cereal b Its translucent hair-like threads gently give way.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: It's incredibly delicate. Elsa stops typing and takes the feather and runs it the o way, Slicing through the box like a razor.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: And dangerous. (beat) You have to stop contradicting me in front of Dren.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: If I say one thing, you can't always be saying, "no, it's okay", or "she doesn't like that".

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: I don't do that. Do I do that?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Just don't make me the bitch, okay. (back to her work) I'm not the bad guy.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Alright. I'm sorry. Clive gets up, dumping his bowl into the kitchen sink.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We should get going. Elsa doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Go ahead.  92 93 82.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Elsa, we talked about this. You have to show your face. We have to keep up appearances.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I'm not wasting my time on Barlow's lost cause. (beat) I'm staying here with Dren. Clive scoops up his duffel bag and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Great. I guess that just leaves me to handle the real world. He slams the door, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive marches to his car, slows as he passes the barn. Fr inside he can hear Dren's beautiful birdsong. Clive presses close to the wall of the barn, peering thro the cracks in the clapboard exterior. CLIVE'S POV: Barely visible through the slats, Dren sits perched elegantly on an overhanging beam. She looks like statue, the only thing betraying life are the exquisitely alien tones that tumble from her puckered lips. Clive can't bring himself to take his eyes off her until, unexpectedly and with shocking speed, she stares right ba at him. Instinctively, he presses himself flat against the wall. Like he's been caught doing something terribly wrong. He hustles over to his car and tears down the dusty drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dexter works with glum fortitude at his work station. Cli is seated next to him. In his hand is Dren's feather. Dex won't even look at it.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: It's incredible, Dex. The way she's changing. She... she's like this impossible symphony of biological processes that just keeps--

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Stop it. Will you listen to yourself? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) She's a mistake. A mistake we're all going to regret. For a very long time.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: She's a living being.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Who was never meant to exist. We could lose everything. Everything.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: You don't know that. Maybe this is what we're supposed to be doing. Maybe it's a natural part of evolution. Did you ever think of that? Dexter gives his brother a hard, long look.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: You know, you can still get out of this. It's not too late.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Turn her in.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Are you fucking nuts?

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: If you come clean... They might cut you some slack. You made a mistake. You got caught up in Elsa's craziness. I know she coerced you into it.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa. Wait a second. That's not true. And even if it was, why would anyone believe it?

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Because that's what I'd tell them. Clive stares at his brother in stunned disbelief. Then...

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: You're jealous. You're jealous because we've done something unbelievable!  94 84.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Shh. Jesus... Lower your voice...

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: ...Because one of us got to be a genius. And it wasn't you! Dexter just blinks, speechless in the face of Clive's biz emotional assault.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: (hushed) I'm just trying to help you.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: (between his teeth) Dexter. I haven't needed your help since we were twelve. Clive storms from the room. Heads turn. Barlow notes his exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa enters the barn and gently approaches Dren, holding a hair-brush as though it were a new toy. Dren looks at i curious, but remains distant and cool.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Guess what we're going to do? Elsa gently brushes Dren's hair which has recently grown quite long and full. Dren, watches herself in the cracked mirror, fascinated, but reluctant to exhibit pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See how pretty you've become? Look how long it is now. (beat) You're going to have to learn how to be a grownup. Elsa puts down the brush and opens the small drawer in th table to retrieve an elastic band. She notices several mottled sheets of paper under a stack of blank sheets, as though deliberately stashed away.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are these? Dren goes rigid. Elsa pulls out a series of slightly crum drawings made with colored pencils. They are crude, rudimentary attempts at a face, but as she flips through them, they exhibit a clear progression of ability.  85.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you do these? These are wonderful! As she gets towards the bottom of the stack and the sketc become increasingly complex, it is obvious that all of th are of Clive.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (hiding disappointment) They're really good, Dren. Are there any of me? Dren remains frozen, her eyes locked on her own reflectio If her odd hybrid features could express embarrassment, t might be it. Elsa's hand scrambles into the drawer, pulling out some f paper and a handful of colored pencils.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Show me? Show me how you draw. Elsa tilts one of the mirrors so that Dren can get a good look at her face.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will you do one of me? (beat) Please? Dren unfreezes and abruptly grabs up all the pictures of Clive. She bolts with them to her hiding place. Elsa sighs, then strides sternly across the room.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's just the two of us, young lady. You're going to have to learn who's boss. Elsa pulls aside the plastic sheet and discovers Dren cro inside, cradling the cat in her arms, stroking it obsessi

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dren. What's that? Where did you get that? Dren shimmies deeper into her hiding spot.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Give it to me. Elsa's hand snatches out and grabs the cat by the scruff the neck, yanking it away. Dren YELPS.  95 96 97 98 99 86.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Dren. We can't keep it. (beat) We can't take a chance. It could make you sick. Dren is horrified. She reaches out for her beloved cat, b Elsa coldly stands up and steps back, suddenly the stern matron.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can't always have what you want. That's a part of growing up too. Elsa heads for the door. Dren's knees curl up under her arms. Her eyes squint with rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa enters the farmhouse with the cat, places it on the floor. It MEOWS needily. She goes to the fridge, pours so milk into a saucer and lays it next to the cat, who hungr laps it up. Elsa sees a portrait of her mother on the wall. Her face stern and joyless, the trademark swatch of white hair tra down her left cheek. Something like regret plays across Elsa's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive's car pulls up the drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive comes into the darkened farmhouse.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: El? No sign of her. He explores deeper into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens a crack. Clive pokes his head inside. Elsa is fast asleep, curled up child-like on the tiny mattress Clive gently pulls a blanket over her, then quietly leave the room, shutting the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive enters the barn. He hears a rustle and sees Dren cu by her private space.  87. Clive walks over and kneels next to her. Dren stares at t floor, her jaw is set and angry.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: What's the matter girl? Dren melts into sorrow the way a child responds to pity. She launches herself into Clive's sympathetic arms, shuddering.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bad day? Clive pulls her gently to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's lighten things up around here. Clive moves to another part of the room, slides a CD into boom-box on the counter. It's the rendition of "Under My Skin" that Dren likes. The music perks her up. She sways in time with it, chortl and whistling. Clive does a comical two-step that brings a hint of a smi to Dren's face. Emulating him, she sways from foot to foo in time with the music.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Atta-girl. I knew we got the dance gene in there. Clive comes up to her, positions Dren's arms on his shoul putting one hand above her hip, the other gently on her b He leads her in a clumsy rocking slow dance, slightly ridiculous at first -- like the ill-matched couples in an elementary school gymnasium.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Follow my lead. They slowly find a measure of synch, despite their differ anatomy. Clive's lead sets an elegant rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll show you how the pros do it. Clive throws a couple of variations into the foot work. Dren, now in the groove, follows perfectly. They become graceful and lightfooted.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My first girlfriend made me take dance lessons. (beat) Don't tell Elsa.  100 88. As though triggered by the hint of conspiracy, Dren tight her grip on Clive, drawing him in close. The move is subt adjusting her balance, but they now dance body-to-body. Dren's eyes close, her head rolls back, getting lost in t music and the intimacy. Despite himself, Clive is becomin aroused. He notes the sensuous length of her neck, the ar of her back, her hair... He freezes. Drops his arms. Dren's eyes open, bewildered. Wondering what she's done wrong. Clive gently brushes back Dren's hair where he finds a SI SHOCK OF WHITE.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Elsa... Dren is annoyed that Elsa's name should interrupt the dan Clive steps back from her, shaken.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. That's enough. (beat) That's enough dancing. Dren. Clive walks over to the boom box and smacks the STOP butt then strides off towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good night. He makes a hasty exit, leaving Dren slumped in the middle the barn like a jilted date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa emerges from her childhood bedroom, rubbing her eyes Clive is already dressed for work, sipping coffee at the table, looking angry.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I thought I was taking a quick nap. I must have... I slept like a rock.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: It's your DNA.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: In Dren. Elsa doesn't have a response, there's no denying it.  101 89.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You put yourself into the experiment. (furious, grasping for the right words) How could... What were you...? I mean, was this ever about the science?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Of course it was. It still is.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: If you really believe that then you're even more fucked up than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: I'm sick of it. I'm tired of being your crutch. I'm tired of your secrets... And your lies.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I didn't lie. I didn't say who's DNA, did I?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, you were very careful. What was it? “Healthy female. Clean heredity"?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Exactly. Why not me? Clive bolts out of his chair, heading for the door.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Maybe you should take another glance at your family history. Clive makes a slamming exit, leaving Elsa alone with his parting jab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa sits depressed at the table, her face tight with frustration and anger. She feels like complete wreckage. Dren is mad at her. Clive's mad at her. She hasn't been t work. Everything's falling apart. Something brushes past her leg and she looks down. It's t cat, rubbing affectionately against her. Elsa's face sudd softens. She picks put the cat and strokes it, relieved that someone, anyone, isn't hating her.  102 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa enters the barn, locking the door behind her with th key she wears around her neck. She carries a cardboard bo under one arm.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Dren, c'mere honey. I have something for you. Dren emerges from her private hiding space, cautious but curious. Elsa sits cross-legged on the floor, patting a spot in front of her for Dren to sit. Dren sullenly compl

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can't you smile for me? Dren lifts her head, expressionless eyes on Elsa, eager t demonstrate that she doesn't merit a smile.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know I love you, don't you? Elsa gives her a warm, loving smile. Dren maintains her cold stare, not giving an inch. Elsa gives her words extr emphasis, determined that Dren understand:

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're a part of me. And I'ma part of you... I'm inside you. (beat) I'll always be here for you. Always. Elsa opens the box and presents the cat. Dren's face grow instantly alert. She glances at Elsa slightly mistrusting

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There you go. You can keep her. Why not? It's nice to have a pet. Elsa gently places the cat on the floor. It approaches Dr rubbing against her leg. Dren cocks her head. Her tail suddenly lashes out -- its deadly stinger jabbin the cat in the skull. It drops dead instantly.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (horrified) My God! Oh, my God? Dren!!! Dren finally gives her the smile she wanted. Elsa lashes out, slapping her hard across the face. Elsa brings both hands up to her own mouth, shocked at wh Dren has provoked.  103 91. In the same instant, Dren lunges forward, pouncing on her knocking her down. A clawed foot grabs the key from aroun Elsa's neck and rips it off. The spiked tail hovers close to her face. There's a moment between them where it seems that Dren mi actually sting her. Elsa's eyes register real fear. The power balance has tipped. Then Dren pushes Elsa backwards, sending her sprawling ac the floor and makes a break for the front door. She awkwa works the key into the lock. CLICK. It opens. With a SQUAWK, Dren pulls off the lock and opens the door Inviting sunlight washes over her as... WHAP! Something has struck the back of Dren's head. She drops. Elsa stands, panting over her, a rusted milk can in her h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dren wakes to find her arms, legs and tail secured to an examination table. Elsa stands over her, a scalpel in hand, her face utterly devoid of emotion. She speaks in a detached, clinical man into a tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: (into tape recorder) Physically H-50 has evolved well. However, recent violent behavior suggest dangerous psychological developments. She brings the knife up to Dren's scalp. Dren CRIES OUT, fights against her restraints. For a moment, we might thi that Elsa is about to perform brain surgery.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Erratic behavior may be caused by a disproportionate species identification. Cosmetically "human" affectations should be eliminated wherever possible. Elsa clicks off the recorder and takes a handful of Dren' hair. She painfully hacks it off with the scalpel. In thi way, Elsa shears Dren's beautiful mane until she is left with a patchy shorn mess. Dren MEWS in anguish at this humiliation. Then, with growing terror, Dren watches as Elsa moves to opposite end of the table, where a small tray of surgical instruments waits. Elsa CLICKS the recorder back on.  104 105 92.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Due to her unstable condition, it has become necessary to remove her zootoxin glands and stinger. Elsa snaps off the recorder, sets it down by the tray. Sh hazards a glance at Dren. Her creation watches her, wide- eyed with terror. Elsa brakes the gaze, pulls up a surgical mask and jabs a hypodermic needle into Dren's tail. With frigid disregard she selects a slender bone-saw from the tray and begins h work. Dren lets out a SAVAGELY SHRILL SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive drives up to the barn. He thinks he hears a HIGH-PI SCREAM under the SOUND OF THE RADIO. He snaps off the mus but there's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive lets himself in and is confronted with the horrific aftermath of an improvised surgery. Dren is strapped semi conscious to the table. Elsa is bandaging the stump of he tail. Long locks of hair litter the floor near a puddle o congealing blood. Dren cranes her neck and cries out to Clive, her fingers flexing and clawing under the straps.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: What I had to. Clive sees an eight-inch segment of tail laying in the si

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Elsa! Clive rushes to the table to unstrap Dren, but Elsa grabs his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: She's become unstable. She killed a cat. She almost killed me.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: And so you... cut off her hair? Elsa doesn't respond. She simply takes the chunk of Dren' tail in her rubber-gloved hand and places it carefully in small picnic cooler filled with ice cubes.  106 93.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Are you any closer to finding the protein?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: What does that have to do with anything?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: You haven't because you're working with tissue that's been dead too long. Clive catches her meaning.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: We don't know that she has it.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Of course she does. She has everything Ginger and Fred had. And more. Elsa moves for the door.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I'm going to solve this thing! I'm going to put things right. She makes her exit. Within moments, Clive can hear the en of their car start. He rushes over to Dren, unties her.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Dren? Dren looks to him with wounded, frightened eyes, as if he were an accomplice in her torture. She weakly retreats to the corner. Clive takes in the shambles of this private hell, the deteriorating condition of the barn. At his feet is the carcass of the dead cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive shovels dirt out of a hole about the size of a larg shoe box. A few feet away is the tombstone of Elsa's moth He gently lowers a small package wrapped in paper towel i the hole. A breeze blows aside the paper and we see that it's the cat.  107 108 109

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and empty but for a light on at a single work statio Elsa is working hard through the night. The cooler is at her feet. A pot of coffee smolders near the microscope. There's a desperate urgency to her work, but an unstoppab determination in her eyes. She's going to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive is agitated, pacing the floor of the bedroom with a tumbler of ice-cubes in one hand. He fumbles on the dress with a bottle of scotch. He pours himself a healthy hit o liquor, tosses it down his throat. His laptop is open. On-screen is a webcam feed from the barn: several cameras trained on various angles encompass the room. No sign of Dren. All at once, her face pops up. Clive catches this. Comes close. Then as if sensing his presence, she abruptly disappears. He flips through several windows, picking her up again fr another angle: She climbs the step ladder, removes her hospital gown and slides into her water tank. He calls up an underwater camera. Dren sensuously rolls h naked body against the wall of the pool, the water acting like a healing salve for her damaged tail. He can't get o how lithe and womanly she has become. Instinctively, he reaches out and runs his fingers along image. As he does this, Dren's own hand reaches out, and impossibly, brushes past the camera, mirroring his gestur Clive jumps back, jolted from his trance. He slams the la shut. He grabs the bottle of scotch and slides to the flo pouring a large gulp down his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa gathers her things into her knapsack, in higher spir than we've seen in a while. As she moves to the door, it swings open. She lets out a startled gasp. It's Barlow.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Bill, you're early.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Let me get this straight. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You stay home because you're sick. But now I find you sneaking around when no one's here?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Making up for lost time.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: It's too late for that. They won't extend the deadline. It's over. You've screwed us all. (beat) While you're here, you might as well clear out Clive's desk.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Barlow explodes.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: No one cares about what you think anymore! You're an embarrassment to this company. It's going to take years to--

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: The protein's been synthesized. Barlow is rendered speechless. She pushes past him and he for the door.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (on the way out) It's in the fridge. When some real scientists get here, have them take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beam of sunlight smacks Clive across the eyes. He hauls himself upright with a pained groan. Whisky and guilt are twin swords slicing his brain.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Elsa? EL?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive trudges though the common room, still a little drun and clearly in pain.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Elsa! He shuffles out the front door.  112 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive finds the barn empty. Elsa is not there, nor is Dre

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Elsa?! Dren?! He zeroes-in on Dren's special hiding place, but she's no there. He bounds up the step ladder only to find the murky water Dren-less. He's beginning to panic, rushing around the ta As he turns, WHAM, Dren is on him. She's planted him with a full-on, open-mouthed kiss. Cliv pulls himself out of it, perhaps a little reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dren, you can't... what are you doing? Dren stares at him hungrily. Her parted lips have a fulln he'd never noticed. Her eyes shine with unabashed, pure lust. The knowledge that some part of her is Elsa somehow heightens the moment. When her mouth finds its way back to his, he plunges in w abandon. Her hospital gown falls off one shoulder. Dren wraps her legs around Clive's torso, driving her breasts to his face, her wings unfurl, flapping excitedly. Clive presses her up against the water tank. They writhe the floor, gown riding up over her waist. Clive quickly fumbles open his pants, tears open his shirt. His mouth is all over her marble-white torso. Dren's tail rides up between his legs, exploring. She arches her back allowing entry. Clive's body surrenders to the moment. In the growing excitement, the bandage on Dren's tail beg to tear off. The stump has already healed over -- And the severed stinger has grown back, protruding from the new s of skin and dripping with fresh venom! It curls around Clive, a hair's breadth from his naked sk But Clive is oblivious, building to climax. A STARTLED GASP pulls him out of it. Clive and Dren freeze as one. Clive quickly turns and see Elsa, paralyzed near the door. Her mouth hangs open in an expression of shocked repulsion. Clive scuttles off Dren, clumsily reassembling his pants.  113 114 115 97.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: (hysterical) Get away! Stay away from me!

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Elsa... I'm sorry... I don't... Clive stands midway between Elsa and Dren. His lips mumbl looking for the right words. They don't exist. He turns from Elsa's disbelieving grimace to Dren's horri face as she sits there half-naked, abandoned in mid-coitu Their looks are IDENTICAL. Mother and daughter. The resemblance hammers Clive's brain. Elsa finally unfreezes. She backs toward the door, gets a hand on the doorknob and tears out of there. Clive takes off after her, clutching his open shirt, slamming the doo behind him. Dren is left on the floor by the tank, her face still wea Elsa's horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa is already in her car, backing around to make a forw exit. Clive pounds on the driver's-side window.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Elsa, don't go. Talk to me. Clive watches helplessly as Elsa burns away with SCREECHI TIRES. He grips his hair. Looks to the pasteurization bar then at the dusty trail of the receding vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (softly) Fuck. Clive quickly locks the barn, then clamors into the van a drives off after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive enters the apartment. Sees a stack of mail has collected on the floor. There's a light on in the kitchen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive finds Elsa at the kitchen table staring into space. He approaches, sheepish, not sure what to expect.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: (low) Don't.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: I guess "I'm sorry" isn't worth much. Elsa explodes.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: "I'M SORRY?" I'm sorry means nothing! It doesn't take ANYTHING away!

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: It just happened. I barely knew...

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I don't even know who you are anymore! You've become something sick! (beat) Forget about what it means to me! There are some things you just DO

dialogues.speaker: NOT DO
dialogues.text: Clive lets her rage wash over him. But something she said catches in his mind. It takes a moment for words to emerg Finally:

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: (quietly) We changed the rules.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: You're not talking your way out of this!

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: We crossed a line. After that... things got confused...

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Confused about what?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Right and wrong.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I don't think you're in a position to talk to me about right and wrong. Now Clive is finding his anger.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Oh... And you are? Why did you want to make her in the first place? For the betterment of mankind? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (no response) You didn't want an normal child because you were afraid of losing control. But an experiment... that's something else.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I love her.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: So, do I. But we fucked up, El. Jesus Christ. We chained her up. Locked her away from the world. Sawed off her fucking tail. Elsa holds her head in her hands. Regret is beginning ecl rage.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I cut off her tail. (beat) It seemed like a good idea at the time.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Fuck. Everything seemed like a good idea. Clive glances around the apartment, taking in their old l Their wide-screen tv, surround-sound stereo, games, gadge luxuries. Their wall of books and toys.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just wish things could go back to the way they were. Elsa raises her head, wiping tears from her eyes. She's bucking up. She's getting her head straight.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I synthesized the protein.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: (stunned) What?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: The CD-356 level in her blood's ten times higher than what Ginger and Fred ever had. She's boiling over with it.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Then... we could save things. Put our lives back together.  116 117 100.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: We could start to. Except for...

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Except. For. Her. Clive just stares at Elsa. An unspoken understanding. Els whispers:

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: We can't do that. Clive's silence says everything.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We can't... We have a responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: The experiment is over. Our responsibility is to end it. Elsa begins to concede to his chilling logic.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: .. How?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: The most humane way possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive and Elsa have returned. They slam the doors to the van and head towards the barn without a word. Clive has a large hypodermic needle in his hand, already uncapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RATTLE of the lock. The SQUEAK of the door opening. Clive and Elsa enter the barn and quickly bolt the door b them. Elsa calls out, careful not to let even a hint of emotion enter her voice.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Dren! Come out Dren. There is no sign of her. The room is quiet. Too quiet. Clive goes to her hiding place. Nothing. They scan the rafters. Elsa climbs up the step ladder to peer into the tank. The water is murky, a slight film on the surface. She brushes the water with her hand. Elsa leans in closer...  101. Dren's face bobs to the surface. Elsa jumps back, nearly losing her balance, but Dren is completely inert. Eyes st sightlessly at her.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (suddenly panicked) Clive! Help me! Clive joins her by the rim, sees Elsa struggling under Dr dead weight, isn't sure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on! Clive drops the needle. Together, with difficulty, they manage to hoist Dren out of the water and lower her to th floor. She feels Dren's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fever. Dren convulses. Her head shaking, body buckling. Elsa dro to her knees, checking Dren's vital signs, puts her head the creature's chest.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Faint. Barely there. Elsa takes Dren under the arms. Clive goes around to the feet. Together they move Dren away from the tank. They gently set Dren down on a cot. Elsa fills the sink with water.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Open the door.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Get some fresh air in here. Elsa comes back to Dren, wiping her brow with a cool, dam cloth. Clive opens the doors to the barn. Fresh air and daylight wash over Dren, pulling her back into consciousness. Her eyes drift to the opening. A gateway to trees, sky, a who universe that she was never allowed to experience. Elsa sees this, feels the regret of a failed parent. One that could never allow her child to prosper in the world. Slowly, Dren's eyes grow weary. She drifts back into unconsciousness.  118 119 120 121 102.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: What do we do? Elsa shakes her head. No answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light has grown dim. Clive is asleep in an old arm ch The sound of SOBBING wakes him. He opens his eyes, sees Elsa from behind, hunched, crying. Dren lies on the cot deathly still. He reaches for Elsa. Then draws his hand back, knowing hi touch can only make things worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive climbs out of a freshly dug shallow grave in the fa plot, next to where the cat had been buried, Elsa's mothe nearby. A single lantern lights their farewell. Elsa gently drops the Barbie doll into the grave. Dren's body is already down there, wrapped in Elsa's old blanket

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Do you, uh... want to say anything? Elsa shakes her head. There are no more tears, no more words. Just the dreadful weight of remorse. Clive shovels earth into the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bonfire crackles in a garbage can near the entrance to barn. Clive throws clothes, molted feathers, garbage... a remaining evidence of Dren into the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barn is nearly cleaned out, the vat drained, equipmen boxed and prepped for moving. Elsa sweeps the last of the garbage off the floor. She ja the broom into Dren's old hiding place and draws back a p of papers. She is suddenly stuck with emotion. These are drawings that Dren had made of Elsa. Not one, n two, but many sketches. All of them hidden away.  122 103. All of them speaking of a secret love that a daughter had for a mother. Tears well in Elsa's eyes. Clive steps into the barn with wheeled dolly.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Almost done? Elsa swallows her emotion, speaks without turning to him.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Almost. Clive, nods. Feels her anguish. But can say nothing more. He hoists a box onto the cart and wheels it to the door.. Stops, sets it down as he hears THE SOUND OF AN APPROACHI VEHICLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive and Elsa come out of the barn as a SEDAN roars up t drive. The door flies open and Dexter steps out. His expression is a combination of stern resolve and guilt.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I had to. It's the only way. The passenger-side door opens and out steps Barlow, furio

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Alright. Let's see it.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: What the fuck, Bill? (beat, then to Dexter) What did you tell him? Dexter glares at her, long buried resentment rising to th surface.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: I didn't have to tell him much.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Do you think I'm stupid? Those samples you gave me had human DNA content. (beat) They didn't come from Ginger and Fred. They came from something else. Something that's still alive. Clive and Elsa can't deny it. He's got them dead to right  104.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (seething) And to think you did it under my watch. (beat) Now. Let me see this thing. It doesn't belong to you.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: "It" doesn't belong to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: You made it at a Novaphorm lab. It's company property. And I want to see it. Right now! Clive and Elsa share a look.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where is it?! They say nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fine. Barlow pulls out his cell phone, starts to dial.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm calling in a forensic team.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: She's already dead. Barlow hangs up the phone. Dexter reacts to this news, relieved but perhaps a little saddened also.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's over, Bill. Elsa pushes past Barlow and heads towards the van. He tra after Elsa. Clive follows, numbly.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: I don't believe you. Elsa picks up a shovel off the ground. Tosses it to Barlo

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: See for yourself. Barlow catches the shovel, looks at it with distaste.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's buried behind the house.  105.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: And how do I know there's only one?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: One was enough.

dialogues.speaker: SHHHRK
dialogues.text: A violent backwash of air. Barlow's face is frozen in an odd state of consternation until... ..-his head slides off his neck. And drops on the lawn. The rest of his body crumbles after it. Elsa SCREAMS, stumbles backwards. Clive reacts, stunned as... Something lands on the ground between them. Something big DREN. Covered in grave dirt. Resurrected. Transformed. MALE. The difference in physiology is unmistakable. The eyes ar now set in the front of the skull, defining him as a pred The arms more developed, hips narrowed, pectorals pure rippling muscle. And the wings are massive, one still coa with a streak of Barlow blood. The only detail that clearly marks this as the Dren that once knew is the blazing shock of white hair on the left side of his head. Male-Dren turns to Elsa, takes a threatening step forward

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: El, run! But she's frozen to the spot, transfixed by this macabre transformation. Dren takes another menacing step forward. Clive leaps between them. Male-Dren instantly attacks, effortlessly flinging Clive into the burning trash can, spilling its contents and setting the ground alight. Dexter lunges to retrieve the shovel. He picks it up and swings. Ina blur of movement, Male-Dren deftly dodges it, and with one sweep of his wings, leaps off Clive, draggin Dexter into the darkness. Elsa rushes over to Clive, bloodied but not badly injured and pulls him to his feet. They watch helpless as sounds violence fill the air.  123 106.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dexter?! No response.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dexter! A deadening calm descends. Nothing but the CRACKLING FIRE Flames lap at the barn door. Elsa tries to pull Clive away.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Come on... Clive shakes her off.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Elsa abandon's him, bolts for the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa jumps into the driver's seat, hands shaking, she pat her pockets, searching for the keys. Clive wrenches open the driver's-side door.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: We can't leave!

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Where's the keys?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: I am not leaving my brother!

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: No, he's--

dialogues.speaker: WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: Dexter. Savagely mauled and very dead. Elsa cries out. Clive stares, mute. From above, THE SOUND OF POWERFUL FLAPPING WINGS. Elsa swallows her horror, leaps out of the van and grabs Clive.  124 125 107.

dialogues.speaker: COME ON
dialogues.text: He's in shock. She half-pushes, half-drags him in the direction of the farmhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa and Clive burst inside, freaking out. Elsa locks the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsa and Clive stumble into the kitchen. She wets a rag i the sink and dabs his wounds.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: What... happened?! Elsa is struck with a realization.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Ginger. The same thing that happened to Ginger. CRASH! Something heavy has landed on the roof. SCRATCHING CLAWING FOOTSTEPS track over their heads. Elsa draws a butcher knife from the kitchen counter. CRASH! Glass shatters in one of the closed rooms. Elsa stands frozen, staring at the door to her old bedroo From beyond the door, she hears a LOUD ROAR, and the TINK OF GLASS. She's drawn to it, despite herself. Clive sniffs the air. Elsa thrusts open the door.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: Don't..! WHOOSH! Flames belch from the room in an explosive backdr Elsa is propelled to the floor. She watches, mesmerized, a chunk of barn lays burning on the mattress. Apparently, Male-Dren thrust it through the window. The entire room i flames. He's smoking them out. Clive grabs Elsa, wrenching her from the sight.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on! Clive drags Elsa to the door. He grabs a flashlight from the counter. Together, they stumble out into the night.  126 127 128 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burst out of the house, Clive clutching the flashlig Elsa the butcher knife. She yanks on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: (terrified) Clive... He turns, sees... Male-Dren perched on the roof, silhouetted by flames. They are frozen by the sight. Slowly, with frightening grace, Male-Dren rises, flexes h wings, towering to his full eight-foot-height. His face shows no evidence of compassion. Old Dren's capacity for human emotion has been replaced by pure animal impulse. He SCREECHES A DEAFENING SCREAM, then crouches to pounce. Clive and Elsa bolt for the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clive and Elsa stumble over rough terrain. Branches whip their face and arms. Thick bushes tear at their legs. Above: FLAPPING WINGS followed by the RUSTLE OF BRANCHES. FLAP, RUSTLE. FLAP, RUSTLE. It's getting closer. It sounds like Male-Dren is flinging himself from tree to tree, tracking them from above. And then nothing. Silence They resume their run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stumble into a waist-deep SWAMPY BOG. Elsa scrambles out onto a rocky embankment. Clive struggles through the sucking mud, gets stuck.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: CLIVE
dialogues.text: I... can't. Cursing, Elsa tries to pull him up on a rock, but they sl knocking the flashlight into the water. Clive watches helplessly as it sinks, the beam illuminating its descent
